---
title: 'Explore Doha: Direct Flights from Manila with Philippine Airlines'
summary: >-
  **Traveling to Doha from Australia has just gotten easier, thanks to
  Philippine Airlines' nonstop flights from Manila to Doha in a codeshare
  agreement with Qatar Airways. This collaboration bridges the gap between
  Australian cities and the captivating capital of Qatar, offering a seamless
  journey for those looking to explore the Middle East.


  For Australians itching for adventure, connecting flights from major cities
  like Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane to Manila before hopping on the direct
  flight to Doha is the most straightforward path. When it comes to cost,
  travelers can expect competitive prices starting from approximately 1,200 AUD
  for a round trip, though prices may fluctuate based on the season and booking
  time frame.


  Speaking of timing, the best periods to visit Doha, considering Australia's
  seasons, are during the Australian autumn and spring. These months align with
  Doha's most pleasant weather, avoiding the scorching summer heat of the Middle
  East.


  Australian passport holders will be relieved to know that entering Qatar is
  hassle-free with visa-on-arrival options, allowing them to stay up to 30 days.
  This ease of access makes Doha an attractive destination for Aussies looking
  for an exotic yet straightforward getaway.


  Culturally, Australians will find Doha a fascinating blend of modernity and
  tradition. It's essential to respect local customs, such as dressing modestly
  and being mindful of cultural sensitivities. English is widely spoken, making
  communication relatively easy for Australian travelers.


  As for practical travel tips, the currency in Qatar is the Qatari Riyal (QAR),
  with 1 AUD equating to approximately 2.55 QAR as of the latest exchange rates.
  Getting around Doha is a breeze with options like taxis, Uber, and a modern
  metro system. For accommodation, options range from luxury hotels to more
  budget-friendly choices, catering to all types of travelers.


  In summary, Doha offers a rich tapestry of cultural and modern attractions,
  easily accessible from Australia via a short stop in Manila with Philippine
  Airlines. It's a journey well worth considering for your next international
  adventure.**


  8.

  coupled with the city's captivating mix of modernity and tradition, makes Doha
  an attractive destination for those looking to diverge from the beaten path.
